thread.title: Aadhaar card hearing on October 14 | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Aadhaar card hearing on October 14 | Deccan Chronicle

author: Deccan
title: Aadhaar card hearing on October 14 | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Deccan Chronicle | J. Venkatesan | October 11, 2015, 07.58 am Representational Image New Delhi: A five-judge Constitution Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India H.L. Dattu will begin hearing on October 14 on a batch of applications from the Centre and others seeking to enlarge the use of Aadhaar card to avail a host of services on voluntary basis.
The CJI had told the Attorney General on Thursday that he will take a decision on the composition of the bench and the listing of the applications by Friday.
Accordingly he has constituted the bench which will also include Justices M.Y. Eqbal, C. Nagappan, Arun Mishra and Amitav Roy.
The apex court by an interim order on August 11 had restricted the use of Aadhaar card for distribution of foodgrains under PDS, supply of kerosene oil and LPG only.
The three-judge bench referred to a larger bench the question whether right to privacy was a fundamental right â€” an issue rooted in the conflicting judgments of the apex court.
An eight-judge Bench in its 1954 judgment and later in 1964 by a bench of six judges had held that the right to privacy was not a fundamental right.
